articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police arrested a man and rescued a child at the centre of a hostage standoff at Hamburg airport on Sunday, ending a crisis that had forced authorities to close the busy air hub.
articles.title: Hamburg airport hostage standoff over, suspect arrested, police say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov's 15-year-old son, who was shown beating a prisoner in custody this year, has been appointed to a senior role in his father's bodyguard, top Chechen security officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Chechen leader's son, who beat a prisoner, made top bodyguard

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nearly 32,000 migrants have reached Spain's Canary Islands on fragile boats from west Africa this year, passing a previous record posted in 2006, regional authorities said on Sunday.
articles.title: Migrants reaching Spain's Canary Islands near 32,000 this year

articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: Opium poppy production in Afghanistan, previously the world's top supplier, has plummeted since the Taliban administration banned the cultivation of narcotics last year, a United Nations report said on Sunday.
articles.title: Afghanistan opium poppy supply plummets 95% after Taliban ban - U.N.

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: Moldovans go to the polls on Sunday to elect mayors of villages, towns and cities after the president accused Moscow of meddling in the votes in Ukraine's western neighbour and a pro-Russian party was barred from the race.
articles.title: Moldova holds local elections amid Russian meddling allegations

articles.author: Tuvan Gumrukcu, Birsen Altayli
articles.description: Turkey's main opposition Republican People's Party (CHP) on Sunday elected Ozgur Ozel as its new leader, ending a 13-year term for incumbent Kemal Kilicdaroglu, as the country gears up for local elections next March.
articles.title: Turkey's main opposition elects Ozgur Ozel as new leader in run-up to local elections

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr on Sunday strongly condemned the killing of a Filipino journalist and ordered the police to conduct an investigation to bring the perpetrators to justice.
articles.title: Philippines' Marcos condemns killing of journalist, orders investigation

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Simon Lewis, Suleiman, Al-Khalidi
articles.description: The United States and its Arab allies appeared divided over Israel's military offensive in Gaza to defeat Hamas, as Washington, alongside Israel, resisted pressure for an immediate ceasefire despite the rising death toll among Palestinian civilians.
articles.title: Arab world, US split on Gaza ceasefire as Israeli offensive presses on

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: In Ukraine's war-ravaged Donetsk region, soldiers dug in near the front line described how Russian artillery had intensified significantly in recent weeks, but said it remains below peaks seen a year ago as both sides struggle to advance.
articles.title: Near Donetsk front line, Ukraine artillery crew face intensifying fire

articles.author: Navesh Chitrakar, Yubaraj Sharma
articles.description: Sobbing relatives of victims from Nepal’s worst earthquake in eight years sat with the bodies of their loved ones on Sunday as rescuers looked for people who could still be trapped in the rubble of collapsed buildings.
articles.title: Sobbing relatives of Nepal quake victims prepare for cremations
